title: website translation question :)
content:
Hello :)

I have a BIG problem with auto translation of websites :(

most of it are presented to me in French (would be fine as I'm French) but a lot of it are very poorly traduced :( it hurts my eyes when I try to read the contents.

example : a German website : ilinuxgeek.com, when shown to me in french it's a real pain in the *** to read it, as not-to-be-translated words ARE translated (FreeNAS is shown as Frein! aqnd so on... pouah!), I would like to have it translated to english instead, as these one will be way better than french translate.

I've looked at the firefox preferences and just can't configure the translate website option ! the pref panel opens but I can't set any options in it... why ?

how to correct this ? I want all german language website presented to me in english when it have no inbuilt option as ilinuxgeek.com. AND english websites NOT translated to french by default !

thanks by advance for the answer :)

Cheers, Jeff

title: AVC1 and AV1 1080p60 YouTube videos are choppy
content:
I am having a problem on Firefox AVC1 and AV1 1080p60 YouTube videos play really bad but VP9 videos play fine only 1080p60 is bad on AVC1 and AV1 720p60 and below are fine i fixed AV1 issue by turning off AV1 now they play as VP9 video 1080p60 is fine but when i force VP9 into AVC1 video that video only shows 360p this issue is only on Firefox i tried same video on Google Chrome it is fine there i tried turning off hardware acceleration it does not fix the problem and also tried editing many settings in about:config none of them helped me is there anyway to fix this performance issue

Here is my pc specs

CPU: Intel Core i3-2120 OS: Windows 10 Pro 64-bit GPU: NVIDIA GeForce 210 512MB DDR3 RAM: 6GB

title: Browser issues
content:
I have used Firefox for a very long time and have always been very happy with it, but lately I am having more and more problems. I have Firefox installed on multiple devices.

On my iPad it no longer lets me stay logged in to websites. No matter what I do with privacy or cookie settings I constantly have to re login to every site I visit, even if I haven't closed the browser. I also cannot use paypal checkout for anything as clicking on the paypal button always opens a blank page instead of the page that would allow me to select my payment choice.

On my desktop sites I normally stay logged into rapidly have the data corrupted to I have to remove the cookies and re login, which defeats the purpose of staying logged in. By rapidly I mean immediately. I can only visit a site once before having to clear the cookies. On at least one site I visit I have not been able to log back in because I get a, "The verification result of reCAPTCHA was incorrect. Please try again." This is only on Firefox and only on my desktop. Nothing I have been able to do have fixed this. I just cannot use this site anymore with Firefox.

I have always been very happy with FIrefox and want it to continue to be my default browser, but the more I have to resort to other browsers for more and more sites the more I feel like I need to move on to something else. Is there a way to fix any of these problems?

Firefox is up to date on both devices. The desktop uses Windows 11 Home 64 bit. The iPad is up to date. The only extension I have is Malware Bytes on the desktop. No extensions on the iPad.

Thank you!
creator: littlediegito

title: Xero - pdf no longer views in software
content: I use Xero accounting software and used to be able to view pdf within the software up until the recent update. Now it just sits with a spinning wheel. I've found that if I change the setting within Firefox to open the pdf within Firefox the issue is fixed in Xero. But then all pdf's open in Firefox instead of the usual Adobe. This breaks other workflows within my organisation as I need to email the pdf straight away when I download it, so my Windows was set with Adobe as the default for opening pdf's but now Firefox has taken that over. There does not appear to be any way to email the pdf from Firefox other than to save it and then find the file and email it from there which is very time consuming. I don't know what has changed in Firefox, but please can you fix it. I see I'm not the only person with this issue.

title: identity.fxaccounts.enabled=false is grayed out, can't login into my account to sync the bookmarks, etc
content:
Hello, I did a lot of search and followed all these advises: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1229615 https://winaero.com/remove-your-browser-is-being-managed-by-your-organization-from-firefox/

1. I have not entry "DisableFirefoxAccounts" in "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Policies\Mozilla\Firefox". 2. I have no policies.json file in firefox directory. 3. I have a message "Your browser is being managed by your organization." in "Settings" (about:preferences). 4. In "about:policies" I have DisableFirefoxAccounts=TRUE. 5. in "about:config" identity.fxaccounts.enabled=false and grayed out.

Please help me to turn on the sync of bookmarks. All these listed issues obviously have something to do with it.
